Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2012 05:42AM kimwhit wrote: I would suggest you get an MRI or whole breast ultrasound, preferably automated and also be sure to visit areyoudense.org this can be screening or diagnostic depending on the referral  - hang in there, Kim 781.258.1116  here is a link to a CA public service announcement about dense breast tissue: http://youtu.be/uXI1t4sKlEY  here is an explanation of the CPT codes:  Coding for Mammography Services by: Stacie L. Buck, RHIA, CCS-P, RCC, CIC President & Senior Consultant, RadRx Email: sbuck@radrx.com Although there are only a handful of CPT codes that apply to mammography services, correct coding for mammography presents many challenges. These challenges exist not because of the complexity of the codes but because of documentation issues and matters of payer policy. The following FAQs will assist you in correctly coding mammography services.  All information contained in the CodeMap® website, CodeMap® training modules, CodeMap® publications, CodeMap® Data Files, and CodeMap® newsletters, briefings and reports is copywritten and may not be reproduced, redistributed, or sold without express written permission of CodeMap®.
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline
